Compute quantile bounds for GP-based count draws

bounds.Rd

This function generates draws from a Gaussian process state, applies Poisson observation noise, and computes quantile bounds of the resulting counts for each observation.

Usage

bounds(
  state,
  n_lambda = 30,
  n_draw = 100,
  quantiles = c(0.025, 0.25, 0.75, 0.975)
)

Arguments

state

A fitted GP state object used as input to gp_draw().

n_lambda

Integer. Number of latent Gaussian process draws.

n_draw

Integer. Number of replicate draws with Poisson noise applied.

quantiles

Numeric vector. Quantiles to compute for the count draws (values between 0 and 1).

Value

A data frame with one row per observation. Contains the columns:

  • id Observation identifier.

  • t Observation time index.

  • Additional columns for each quantile requested, named q{quantile} (e.g. q0.025, q0.5).

See also

gp_draw, quantile
